byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and ERIC DASH
byline.contributor: Landon Thomas Jr. and Jack Ewing contributed reporting.

abstract: Stocks rally on news of broad European plan to fix sovereign debt problem, but critics are quick to discourage euphoria; say fix is tenuous at best and may not deliver necessary relief to Greece; point to several credit markets, including Italian bonds, in which there was no significant response to announcement of plan.
snippet: Skeptics of efforts by European officials to tackle Greece’s debt burden are saying some main elements of the agreement may not be as good as they looked initially.
lead_paragraph: Skeptics of efforts by European officials to tackle Greece’s debt burden are saying some main elements of the agreement may not be as good as they looked initially.

headline.main: Gauging the Fallout of Another Rescue
headline.print_headline: Gauging the Fallout of Another Rescue: Harsh Realities May Challenge Initial Enthusiasm
